caption: Table 1: Results with linked entities. All LSR models use a DistilBERT backbone. DyVo uses entities found by the REL entity linker and LaQue entity embeddings. All documents are truncated to the first 512 tokens.
description: Table 1 presents the results of experiments comparing LSR models with and without linked entities, along with several other baselines, across three datasets using various evaluation metrics.

caption: Table 1: Results with linked entities. All LSR models use a DistilBERT backbone. DyVo uses entities found by the REL entity linker and LaQue entity embeddings. All documents are truncated to the first 512 tokens.
description: Table 1 shows the performance comparison of different LSR models with and without linked entities, using various evaluation metrics (nDCG@10, nDCG@20, R@1000) across three datasets (TREC Robust04, TREC Core 2018, CODEC).

caption: Table 3: Results with different entity embeddings. All models are trained with a DistilBERT backbone and L1 regularization (weight=1e-5). Entity candidates generated by GPT4 are used on queries for inference.
description: Table 3 presents a comparison of different entity embedding techniques within the DyVo model, showing the impact of various embedding methods on different evaluation metrics across three datasets.

caption: Table 1: Results with linked entities. All LSR models use a DistilBERT backbone. DyVo uses entities found by the REL entity linker and LaQue entity embeddings. All documents are truncated to the first 512 tokens.
description: Table 1 presents the results of experiments comparing different LSR models with and without linked entities, showing the impact on retrieval effectiveness using various metrics.
